Description: Amuletic string: composed of twenty-eight of large, long truncated convex bicone beads of amethyst and a green feldspar 'ba'-amulet. One of the beads is very mis-shapen and could perhaps be an unfinished scaraboid or an attempt at faceting.
Curator's comments: For 'ba'-amulets, cf. W. M. F. Petrie, ‘Amulets’ (London, 1914), pl.XXXIII, 185e-h: Petrie calls these amulets female sphinxes with cat bodies; H. Junker, ‘Bericht über die Grabungen der Akademie der Wissenschaften in Wein auf den Friedhöfen von el-Kubanieh-Nord. Winter 1910-11’ (Vienna, 1920), pl. 10, group 80. 13.m.3; E. R. Ayrton, C. T Currelly and A. E. P. Weigall, ‘Abydos’ III (London, 1904), pl.XII, group 2; T. E. Peet, ‘The Cemeteries of Abydos, part II. 1911-12’ (London, 1914), pl.x, groups 9, 10; W. M. F. Petrie, ‘Diospolis Parva: the Cemeteries of Abadiyeh and Hu. 1898-9’ (London, 1901), pl.XXVII, group W 38; Earl of Carnarvon & H. Carter, 'Five Years' Exploration at Thebes, 1907-11' (London, 1912), pl.XLVI, 2F: all Middle Kingdom.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (425)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2006-2007 6 Oct-18 Feb, Tokyo, National Museum of Nature and Science, Mummy: The Inside Story 2007 17 Mar-17 Jun, Kobe City Museum, Mummy: The Inside Story
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
